data: ANES Labour REMifentanil Patient Controlled Analgesia (PCA) (Module)
Ensure BC Women's Hospital consent form completed
Labour REMifentanil Patient Controlled Analgesia Protocol
Ensure REMifentanil PCA Patient Information Sheet is given to the patient, available through online resource library
Ensure BC Women's Hospital consent form completed
Call Pediatrics (to be present at delivery and informed of REMifentanil PCA use)
Do NOT give any Opioids, CNS Depressants, and other analgesics unless approved by Anesthesiology, Family Practice Maternity Service Group 2 or Perinatal Addictions Service
Continuous nursing presence required while REMifentanil PCA connected to patients and for 15 minute post cannula removal
Upon discontinuation of REMifentanil PCA, record IV removal in nursing record
If inadequate analgesia or other problems with fentanyl PCA

For patients less than 60 kg: 20 mcg starting dose, 2 minute lockout interval, no background infusion
For patients 60 to 80 kg: 30 mcg starting dose, 2 minute lockout interval, no background infusion
For patients greater than 80 kg: 40 mcg starting dose, 2 minute lockout interval, no background infusion

PCA dose changes:
- Only increments of 10 mcg are available
- Minimum bolus dose: 10 mcg
- Maximum bolus dose: 50 mcg
Therapy Type: IV PCA, Infusion Mode: PCA dose only, 20 mcg PCA dose, 2 min lockout interval, 1-hour limit: 600 mcg, pump type: CADD, IV
